creator: mk1325
title: Training Heart Rate Zone Monitor Watch
materials_required: NeoPixel Ring - 12 RGBW LEDs - Cool White
description: This project is about creating a portable biosensor in the form of a watch that monitors the user's heart rate during workouts and alerts them when they enter specific heart rate zones. It uses a pulse sensor, Flora microcontroller, and NeoPixel ring to visually indicate the current heart rate zone and a vibrating motor to alert the user when they exceed their maximum heart rate.
steps: Wire the NeoPixel ring to the Flora by connecting 'IN' to '#6', 'PWR' to 'VBATT', and 'GND' to 'GND'.
(Optional) Wire a button to the Flora by connecting one leg to '#12' and another to 'GND'.
Wire the vibrating motor to the Flora using a diode, transistor, and resistor.
Attach the red wire of the vibrating motor to the striped end of the diode and the blue wire to the other end.
Connect the diode (red wire side) to '3.3V' on the Flora.
Connect the other side of the diode to the transistor collector (right pin).
Connect the transistor emitter (left pin) to ground.
Connect the transistor base (center pin) to a resistor, then connect the resistor to 'GND' on the Flora.
Wire the pulse sensor to the Flora by connecting the purple wire to '#10', the red wire to '3.3V', and the black wire to 'GND'.
Attach the battery to the Flora by plugging the white connector into the battery component.
Upload the code to the Flora, which collects heart rate data, categorizes it into zones, and controls the NeoPixel ring and vibrating motor accordingly.
After soldering all connections to make the watch more robust, assemble the watch by attaching the NeoPixel ring and other components to the watch cuff.
Sew or glue the NeoPixel ring and Flora to the watch cuff, ensuring the on/off switch is not covered.
Tuck the battery and vibrator under the Flora/NeoPixel ring.
Securely sew the pulse sensor to the underside of the watch cuff where it will contact the wrist.
